intro: Tetraclea subinclusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetraclea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Tetraclea subinclusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
